snippet: A committee of Parliament held new hearings on the way the broadcaster had given large severance payments to senior editors in an effort to reduce its budget.
abstract: Committee in British Parliament holds new hearings on large severance payments made by the BBC to senior editors in an effort to reduce its budget; at issue were payments made largely when Mark Thompson, who is now the president and chief executives of The New York Times Company, was director general of the broadcaster.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and STEPHEN CASTLE

lead_paragraph: A committee of Parliament held new hearings on the way the broadcaster had given large severance payments to senior editors in an effort to reduce its budget.

headline.main: Lawmakers Show Anger Over BBC Severance Pay
